reviews.text: Great selection of shops, places for food and the cinema. Toilets in good condition, including family rooms for those with more demanding needs. Train station on the one side, bus station on the other. Comfortable 10 min stroll into the centre of Aberdeen.

Just a shopping mall with loads of chain stores. There is nothing distinctive about this place to make it particularly pertinent to Aberdeen.
That is not to say the shops or restaurants are poor quality. It's just that they could be anywhere in the UK.

Good clean shopping mall, good shops and restaurants. Enjoyed the cinema and the popcorn. The fact that you can bring a beer into the cinema is really good! The mall is clean and well maintained with stalls on Saturday that makes it a bit different. The bus and train station are there too which makes it comfortable
The shops are good, but there simply aren't enough of them. Union Square should have another level. 3 rather than 2 would've provided enough shops to cater for all.

It's a great place to go if you like to queue. You queue to get in. You queue to park your car. You queue to pay in the shops. You queue to get something to eat. You queue to pay for the pleasure of queuing. Then guess what when you want to leave, you have to queue.

Beautiful church. Daily Mass is in the chapel on the left of the main church. Entrance is hidden between the buildings, so it was a little hard to find. No kneelers in the main church, but it's a beautiful, peaceful place to pray. Thankfully they keep the church accessible during the day, which is nice.

A classic church that was built before and actually survived the Chicago fire. Tons of history. Beautiful interior with very picturesque stain glass windows. It is in the heart of old Town with scenic walks straight down to the lake and Lincoln Park Zoo.
This is a church built based on mid 19th century Bavarian churches. The interior is worth a visit. Keep in mind that I am not a Catholic, so I am purely looking at the architectural aspect. 🙂.
This is a beautiful sanctuary in an historic church. I got to sing Handel's Messiah with other members of the Apollo Chorus as guests of the church's Schola Cantorum.
Many GREAT MEMORIES, WHILE ATTENDING @VAN GORDER WALDEN SCHOOLSCHOOL...@GREGORYDANIELS@JoanLoPrestI@@Amazingedibles
A place where you can find your peace
Very beautiful church.
A true historical, cultural and religious landmark of the city.
Beautiful church inside serve in Hungarian language.
Worth visiting!
Besides being the first Romanian Catholic Church in Cluj, it's a small a nice place in the heart of the city for a few minutes with yourself.
First Greek-Catholic church in Kolozsvár (1800-1803)
o biserica super  frummoasa incarcata de istori  din pacate lasata de izbeliste ani la rand ,se pare ca acum au inceput reparatile
Rusine pentru cei care ar trebui sa raspunda de felul in care a ajuns aceasta biserica!Jalnic!

The architecture of the building it is situated in is interesting, and there are some paintings by famous Romanian artists, but I expected to see more paintings, maybe some by internationally painters, which was not the case.
One of the remarkable buildings, represents an important era which defines the history of the city. Unfortunately it is in deplorable condition.
A place to visit for Art lovers. One of the best spot around the center. It’s a must to see!
Very nice.Fine building.Easy accessible
Romanian artists with rare paintings.it is a very good way to understand the Romanian art evolution. The guide is recommended.was well informed and pleasant.
Amazing shows, amazing vibe. Hella worth it.
Very cool creative place with lots of artists around and strange performances haha but cool

Want contemporary art, cool, quirky-whimsy and fancy art oriented events, this is the place. Has debates on topical issues, live performances, colored parties and well organized exhibitions. It used to be until 2017 an important emerging art centers in Cluj-Napoca, featuring artist from different fields: theater, visual art, painters, music etc., unfortunately it started fading away with lots of artists and NGO's leaving the space as part of the building has been rent for corporation offices, the gentrification has its ways. I still think it's worth visiting, you'll find plenty of interesting people and creations.
Almost definitely the most interesting place in Cluj for contemporary art. Helga was so nice to show me around. Certainly worth a visit
Cool venue hosting a variety of interesting events, from live performances to parties.
Very nice. Large spaces with walking tracks, a water body with ducks, boating for Children. The best part - free of vehicles. Very nice ambience. Different varieties of trees. Very well maintained.

Good place to get the vibe of the city. You can get good pictures both day and night. Has public toilet near the parking lot. Has parking for cash. Good place to catch a protests, concert or vendors near national hollydays. Bad for the fact that street performance is in a grey area in Romania.

The kids loved it. It is called by the locals "The big park". 
It is a beautiful place to take a walk and presents with lots of things to do for families. The snack shacks are a must visit too.

Although its the ground place for Untold festival, in the meantime some may find this once biology studying garden quite full of art works, especially in the old casino, and it has a good vibe all the way through because its simply filled with little sights like two lovers on a bench or a group singing, sometimes some street performers, etc. Highly recommending this one cause its free, healthy, and right in the very heart of this town. Did i mention how clean it is?

It's beautiful full of cute dogs and other pets.  It got a lake and in the summer u can take a boat on it, it got a old school casino, a fancy pub, public toilets, an artist house where students show their art. But the best thing about this place is the fact that people gather in a area and sing and drink without disturbing the families and also in the Central Park in the summer they organize Jazz in the park festival.

Definitely worth walking up the hill to enjoy a beautiful view over the whole city. At the hotel bar (outside seating) you can enjoy fantastic cocktails in the sun with a great view. I can also recommend walking up very early in the morning to see the sun rise or staying up late for star gazing! I love this place
Nice park to have a walk and enjoy some amazing views over the city. There are a few bars where you can enjoy a nice drink.
For kid very fine, but no parking place.
Good place to have an overview of the city, relax and charge up with good energy.
Lovely place you can take pictures.
Very nice. Large spaces with walking tracks, a water body with ducks, boating for Children. The best part - free of vehicles. Very nice ambience. Different varieties of trees. Very well maintained.

Good place to get the vibe of the city. You can get good pictures both day and night. Has public toilet near the parking lot. Has parking for cash. Good place to catch a protests, concert or vendors near national hollydays. Bad for the fact that street performance is in a grey area in Romania.

The kids loved it. It is called by the locals "The big park". 
It is a beautiful place to take a walk and presents with lots of things to do for families. The snack shacks are a must visit too.

Although its the ground place for Untold festival, in the meantime some may find this once biology studying garden quite full of art works, especially in the old casino, and it has a good vibe all the way through because its simply filled with little sights like two lovers on a bench or a group singing, sometimes some street performers, etc. Highly recommending this one cause its free, healthy, and right in the very heart of this town. Did i mention how clean it is?

It's beautiful full of cute dogs and other pets.  It got a lake and in the summer u can take a boat on it, it got a old school casino, a fancy pub, public toilets, an artist house where students show their art. But the best thing about this place is the fact that people gather in a area and sing and drink without disturbing the families and also in the Central Park in the summer they organize Jazz in the park festival.
Pleasantly surprised by the organised and quick process of changing an ID card. Visited at mid-day.
No,i don t like it,the only thing what its nice its the building
Five stars for the beautiful historical building only - the authorities don't deserve that much. At least they nicely restored the building, though.
Nice building with a very good mayor. Emil Boc will remain in Cluj-Napoca history because the entire city had become at a very good overall rate.
great looking historical building

Definitely worth walking up the hill to enjoy a beautiful view over the whole city. At the hotel bar (outside seating) you can enjoy fantastic cocktails in the sun with a great view. I can also recommend walking up very early in the morning to see the sun rise or staying up late for star gazing! I love this place
Nice park to have a walk and enjoy some amazing views over the city. There are a few bars where you can enjoy a nice drink.
For kid very fine, but no parking place.
Good place to have an overview of the city, relax and charge up with good energy.
Lovely place you can take pictures.
Really nice. Hoverer the church behind was under renovation and not open for public
This is exactly in the center of the city Cluj Napoca. The Saint Michael church behind the statue is worth visiting!
Such a nice square to visit. One of the best spot in the city. It’s a must to see!
Nice place,in middle of the town.
Piața Unirii. Is used a lot for all kinds of activities. It's a must, special in the weekend.

We have been to this place twice. First about 3 years ago and second time last October. First time I would rate 5* and second time just 1*, as a result average score is 3*. I very much hope that they will get back to the quality they had. It was simply a perfect lunch first time !
Friendly staff, delicious and abundant local food with fresh ingredients at reasonable prices.

A friend and I had lunch here a few months ago. We made reservations for 1:00pm when the kitchen opened, and after an hour my friend had to leave to make an appointment. I had a bit of my dessert left and decided to stay 5 minutes after she left to finish. A few minutes after she left our waiter came up to me at the table and told me I would have to leave soon to free the table. I agreed, but no less than two minutes later a different man came up to me and told me I had to go that moment. I left before finishing my food, less than an hour and a half after we had arrived. I was flustered, embarrassed, and in shock at being kicked out of a restaurant despite having a reservation and staying within a reasonable timeframe. I understand that they're a busy restaurant, but they should budget at least an hour and a half for each sitting in order to avoid rushing patrons. I speak Spanish proficiently so nothing was lost in translation. I've never experienced such rude service in my life, and it was a shame because up until then the meal had been great.

Came across this place by accident. We were really lucky to get a table as they have full reservation. The price is amazing for 3 courses lunch with drink included!!!!! Fully recommended! But book in advance:)
Food great staff very accomplished
Best cabbage place in town. Great service. Really affordable prices. Don't expect a fancy location.

Great place to try local foods and its where the locals go. The menu is available in 3 languages including Hungarian and English. Staff also speaks good English. Prices are below average and you can pay by card. My recommendation is the tripe soup (add extra vinegar).
Always great to be at this last relic of the days past. Gret simple food as in the old days.
If you are in Cluj and want to try the authentic dish in a communist way, this place is probably the best. It's right in the city center. The food is good and the server's are nice.
The design is quite antique, but the service and food are brilliant! Totally recommending it, if you're not interested in the design.

We went there because it's said it's non stop, we arrived at 4:30am and when we decided what to get at 4:45am and they said that they only serve soups. We ordered, and in less than an hour they said they were closing for cleaning. How's that non-stop?
Also we ordered cappuccino and we got hot chocolate and we were charged for bread which we didn't order and we didn't got. Was just added to the bill. My friends didn't want to complain so we just paid and left. 
Anyway shouldn't be called a non stop place if you don't serve food all day and night long.
Plenty of menu choices. Very good food. Big portions. Romanian traditional food. Affordable prices.

Very poor cooked meal, i ordered a burger and it had fries but i was forced to buy extra fries, i do not know why. A burger from mcdonalds tastes better and it costs 5 lei not 40 lei, i am dissapointed by them.
Just wow. I love this restaurant now, I think it'll be the new first choice when wanting to dine out, I mean just look at this plateau 🤤🤤🤤🤤 highly recommend
Nice and helpful staff, food quality around 3/5.

It's a cool place. The view is breathtaking from the terrace at the last level, so it's a must while in Cluj. You can only enter using the elevator on the outside of the Central building. The food is good and they have their own brand of beer among other local or foreign craft beers. Prices are at the same level as all downtown. It's a big place and when it gets very crowded, serving could be faster.

It's good view over the city. Good food. It's easy to get there with and the bus. Unfortunately when i get there with my girlfriend we wanted to stay on the terrace a waiter told us with arrogance that we need to go inside because it's cold and he olny have a t-shirt. Then another waiter told us after we order that we can go out if we want...
Great food with a young, upbeat, modern environment! Friendly staff who will go out of their way for you to be 100% satisfied! Also the location gives you an amazing view to the city.

Good food.
This restaurant is a little more commercial.
The staff are quite friendly.
The food - is tasty and inexpensive. The portions are not normal Romanian size but a little smaller. The menu is quite varied, from traditional to Italian. They have a great choice of local beers. They actually brew there own beer.
The restaurant is frequented by tourists and Romanians a like.
Nice food and decent price for what you receive. they also have nice beer. the down side is the view from the roof top which looks like a building in construction for the moment.

A cozy place in the centre of the town, with a diverse menu, delicious food and a great selection of wines. Perfect for a business lunch/dinner or a classy date. I really like the atmosphere and I recommend it if you want to avoid the "touristy" places in the city centre.

Great little restaurant with great food. The staff were extremely friendly. The service was great. There is a good choice of dishes. The food is fresh and we'll prepared. I recommend this place. It is just around the corner from the City Plaza, Double Tree by Hilton.

Not a very pretentious place and that is exactly why I like it. The service is impeccable, the food is really tasty (i've tried beef soup, duck with sour cherries and red cabbage, beef steak, various pastas and lava cake on different occasions, and i was never disappointed. The place is neat and tidy and the prices are good. Overall a very pleasant experience and excellent value for money. Strongly recommend this restaurant

The place is stylish, welcoming and with a cozy, intimate vibe. I only got to try the coffee and the lava cake (which was AMAZING) but I will definitely come here for more. The staff is very polite. It's quite a fancy restaurant.
I've had an amazing dinner with a good company. The staff was very professional and friendly and the food was really good.
The food was decent, the staff were very friendly. Nothing to complain about but nothing great either
Ok.
Din pacate...sista si unica ocazie sa jupoaie oameni de bani daca din nefericire se afla sa stapaneasca cum-va famea !!! Servire si calitatea anca farte de parte de satisfacut !!!
Papa bun
Acceptabil
I was here with some colleagues more randomly but we all are very pleased with the place. Every dish was nice and we enjoyed our stay a lot

Firstly, a nice and warm place, but I think that staff can be improved. Prices are medium and food is good. The design is traditional and make you to feel the real rural atmosphere of Romania. They have traditional beverages, such as "visinata"; "palinca". In conclusion it's a good place, but it's not my first choice for a meal.
Traditional Romanian restaurant, the location is very secluded. The food was good. We had the venison and wild boar goulash, delicious. You can also get local craft beer at this establishment.

An amazing restaurant, located close to the city center, but it's still at a calm place. Waitresses are super kind, with a good english level! You will get exactly what you want, and it's definetely worth the money. Fast service, and delicious meals!

Serious local cuisine. Heavy duty delicious cooking + professional politeness of staff + good management + tasteful arrangement = what else could a gourmet wish?  Reasonable prices?  They got them. 
Enjoy!

Rooms are OK only for sleep,  try to watch TV, too much noise all the time,  specially in the morning.   Buffet Dinner is same all  the time,  they just enjoying in chicken...staff are friendly. WiFi slow
My father visting last 2 nights.Happy experience in d service

Breakfast is not that good, the dinner menu is even worse and overpriced tastes like everything is frozen microwave food. Today I came back to the room at 18:00 and it wasn't cleaned. The machines at the gym are old. The room I am in you can hear dogs barking all night.
Nice hotel with good service. Recommended
Great Hotel Suggestion to all indian Stay Here

After getting to know them better, I eat at least once per month at Tokyo Japanese Restaurant. The service is absolutely impecable, the food is great, and the quality is constant. You never get bad sushi, bad soup, or soggy tempura. The awesome fish selection, availability of Japanese beverages and the care and dedication towards the food and the customer makes me want to go there again and again.

I've been visiting this restaurant every once in a while for years. Today the service and quality of the food were amazing, as always (I didn't realize I hadn't left a review until now). 

This is one of the (unfortunately) very rare places I know of in Cluj where I am confident I won't be let down when I return, and that's why I prefer Tokyo over other places for special moments.

I've become more and more appreciative of places that are able to offer the same great food and service constantly, irrespective of the time of year or how busy the restaurant is. 

I've been to Tokyo on quiet afternoons or on days when every table was booked and I noticed no difference in the experience - and that's just one of the things I love about this restaurant.

The food tastes amazing, in particular the seafood is well prepared and always fresh, and you can have sakuramochi for desert! 

The menu is varied and can offer a great experience of Japanese cuisine. It's even possible to order dishes consisting of smaller portions of various entrees and deserts, a really nice idea for those of us who have a hard time deciding what to order.

The staff are always ready to offer a smile and good advice, and they seem to know everything there is to know about the menu.

The atmosphere is intimate and quiet, with airy rooms that take your mind off the cluttered city, and the music is soothing and not too loud. I've noticed people tend to speak in hushed tones, and that can be a welcome change from the usual types of places where you need to raise your voice over the music and over the voices of people at other tables, but you do need to be in the mood for it.

There is more I could say about Tokyo, but it's probably better to visit them and discover for yourselves a place that strives to offer perfection in the smallest details, and, at least in my opinion, achieves it.

Thank you for a wonderful evening and for the care and attention to details you always spoil us with.

It was my first time for my friends and me in this restaurant. The service is amazing. You are being greeted by everyone with a nice smile. The woman at the reception kindly took our luggages and kept for the time being there.
The waitress was also very polite and helped us with the menu. She also knew what dishes were vegan and/or gluten-free. 
The food was very very good and we didn't wait so long for it.
If I am ever going back to Cluj, I will definitely go back to this restaurant!

Awesome food and service. The person who served us was very nice and hospitable.
I find the design of the restaurant quite boring.

Taste and quality of the Sushi was really nice. The service very welcoming and discrete.
Only thing I would recommend is to improve the presentation and arrangement of the food

One of the best dining experiences you can have while in Romania. The food is flawlessly executed by a real team of talented chefs. The staff is attentive and friendly, and the atmosphere lovely too. This is one of my favourite restaurants in Romania, and all 3 times I was there I was amazed by the meal!

Extraordinary service, truly creative food and plating and a great selection of wines. The staff was also very helpful and professional. At the moment of writing this, Baracca was the best culinary experience in Romania.

Old furnishings. Low ambience. Not much of music. Below average food. Rude waiters..no money to value.. I saw a cafe round the corner offering much better food and drinks for less than half the price.. I really don't have any positives to tell, seems the place runs on a hype.. Better to avoid!

Great food, it really is something else. A wonderful experience, but I strongly recommend you to book a table, otherwise it will be awkward when you get there. Let's just say we(my wife and I) didn't felt welcomed at all. The attitude changed towards the middle of our staying there. Perhaps some of the staff needs to have a cold, professional approach, who knows? There was a nice lady who smiled at us and another gentleman, the one who served us dinner, that was also kind and smiling. The other 3 people, extremely professional, but lacked a more friendly approach. Other than that, great, exceptional food and desserts. It is the first place where the food makes up for other small inconveniences.
Absolutely amazing. Original, complex and delicious dishes. Felt like dinner was a constant surprise.
Really nice. Hoverer the church behind was under renovation and not open for public
This is exactly in the center of the city Cluj Napoca. The Saint Michael church behind the statue is worth visiting!
Such a nice square to visit. One of the best spot in the city. It’s a must to see!
Nice place,in middle of the town.
Piața Unirii. Is used a lot for all kinds of activities. It's a must, special in the weekend.
